item.title: 租赁活动回暖，曼哈顿公寓租金仍下跌
item.description: 5 月份，曼哈顿的公寓租金出人意料地出现下滑，在通常最繁忙季节的开端，市场出现了 "横盘 "走势。【原文：Manhattan apartment rents unexpectedly slipped in May, a “sideways” move for the market at the start of one of its typically busiest seasons.】

item.title: 中国电动汽车股上涨，押注关税可控：街谈巷议
item.description: 中国电动汽车股上涨，原因是分析师称，欧盟初步宣布的关税上调符合市场预期，对于比亚迪股份有限公司等具有成本优势的公司来说是可控的。【原文：Chinese electric-vehicle stocks gained as analysts said the European Union’s preliminary announcement of tariff increases was in line with market expectations and manageable for companies with cost strength like BYD Co Ltd.】

item.title: 申银万国在伦敦首次公开募股大潮中坚韧前行
item.description: 伦敦的银行家们等待首次公开募股反弹已经两年多了。当快速时尚新贵 Shein 可能以 500 亿英镑（约合 640 亿美元）的估值上市的消息首次传出时，伦敦金融城看到了一笔可能最终扭转低迷的交易。【原文：London bankers have waited more than two years for initial public offerings to bounce back. When news of fast-fashion upstart Shein’s potential listing first emerged at a potential £50 billion ($64 billion) valuation, the City saw a deal that could finally reverse the slump.】

item.title: 日本基金出售九年来最大一笔外债
item.description: 在全球央行政策转向的背景下，日本投资者上周抛售了九年来最大量的外债。【原文：Japanese investors sold the largest amount of foreign debt in nine years last week amid a shift in global central bank policy.】

item.title: 新加坡港口集装箱堵塞加剧，船舶避开红海
item.description: 新加坡的港口已经是世界上最繁忙的港口之一，随着船只为避开红海而改道，更多的集装箱船驶向这个亚洲海运枢纽，该港口正面临着一个持续拥堵的时期。【原文：Singapore’s port, already one of the busiest in the world, is facing a sustained period of congestion as vessel diversions to avoid the Red Sea push more container ships to the Asian maritime hub.】

item.title: 中国商人价值 2,000 万美元的俄罗斯铜矿失踪
item.description: 中国一家巨型国有大宗商品贸易商在一批来自俄罗斯、价值近 2,000 万美元的铜货物失踪后，损失惨重，这再次引发了人们对原材料买卖市场欺诈行为的担忧。【原文：A giant state-owned Chinese commodities trader is nursing losses after a shipment of copper from Russia worth nearly $20 million went missing, reigniting fears over fraud in the often secretive market for buying and selling raw materials.】

item.title: 萨巴集团请求法官阻止贝莱德集团使用有争议的附则
item.description: 萨巴资本管理公司（Saba Capital Management）要求法官阻止贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：Saba Capital Management asked a judge to block BlackRock Inc. from using a tactic that Boaz Weinstein’s firm says allows the world’s largest asset manager to deny investors their rights to chose who will run one of its closed-end funds.】

item.title: 在家庭收入不断增长的背景下，印度需要在本十年内建造 1 亿套住房
item.description: 据印度最大的开发商之一的一位高级官员称，随着世界上增长最快的主要经济体家庭收入的不断提高，印度对新住宅的需求日益旺盛，印度住宅建筑商可能需要在本十年内建造多达一亿套新住宅。【原文：Indian home builders may have to construct as many as 100 million new dwelling units this decade as rising household incomes in the world’s fastest-growing major economy buoy demand for new residences, according to a top official at one of the country’s largest developers.】

item.title: PAG 为新亚洲私募股权基金筹集的资金仅为目标 90 亿美元的一半
item.description: 亚洲最大的另类资产管理公司 PAG 将于本月晚些时候完成其最新收购基金 40 亿美元的筹款，达到原定目标的一半以下，熟悉此事的人士说，因为投资者不愿意向该地区投入新的现金。【原文：PAG, Asia’s biggest manager of alternative assets, will close the fundraising for its latest buyout fund at $4 billion later this month, reaching less than half of its original target as investors balk at putting new cash into the region, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 石油连涨三天后趋于平稳，库存和美联储成为关注焦点
item.description: 由于投资者权衡了美国原油库存意外增加和美国货币政策前景（预计将在更长时间内收紧），原油在连续三日上涨后趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied after a three-day advance as investors weighed an unexpected build in American crude stockpiles and the outlook for US monetary policy, which is expected to be tighter for longer.】

item.title: 墨西哥银行为应对比索暴跌的硬仗准备工具
item.description: 墨西哥央行敞开了干预比索的大门，这是对大选后比索暴跌至 15 个月低点后市场动荡不安的承认。【原文：Mexico’s central bank opened the door to intervening in the peso, an acknowledgment of the turmoil roiling the market after a post-election rout sent the currency tumbling to a 15-month low.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。美联储预计今年只会降息一次。一项调查显示，无论如何，股市有望继续反弹。特斯拉要求降低关税。市场动向如下。【原文：Good morning. The Federal Reserve pencils in just one rate cut this year. Stocks are expected to keep rallying regardless, a survey shows. Tesla asks for lower tariffs. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 亚洲股市有望在美联储会议后跟随美国股市走高：市场综述
item.description: 由于美联储对利率的谨慎展望几乎没有改变华尔街对降息的押注，亚洲股市将追随美国股市走高。【原文：Asian stocks are set to track US peers higher as the Federal Reserve’s cautious outlook on interest rates did little to alter Wall Street’s bets on cuts.】

item.title: 美联储决议和 CPI 公布后的亚洲市场看点
item.description: 在美联储利率决议和美国消费者物价数据的所谓双重打击之后，亚洲交易员期待着风险资产迎来小幅利好的一天。【原文：Asia traders are looking forward to a modestly positive day for risk assets after the so-called double-whammy of a Federal Reserve rate decision and US consumer price data.】

item.title: 中国曾经强大的信贷周期正在世界市场上逐渐消失
item.description: 中国的信贷引擎曾为全世界的工业和市场提供动力，但如今却陷入低速运转，并将继续如此。【原文：China’s credit engine, which once powered industries and markets all over the world, is stuck in low gear – and set to stay there.】

item.title: 禁令最后期限临近，韩国将讨论卖空规则调整问题
item.description: 韩国将于周四考虑修改其卖空规则，这也是正在进行的关于何时解除对这种交易策略的禁令的讨论的一部分。【原文：South Korea will consider changes to its short-selling rules Thursday as part of ongoing discussions on when to lift the ban on the trading strategy.】

item.title: 吉姆-查诺斯说，在 "欺诈的黄金时代 "很难筹集到现金
item.description: 从太阳能股票到数据中心，传奇投资人吉姆-查诺斯（Jim Chanos）认为做空者有很多机会。问题是：像他这样的看空基金经理仍在努力筹集资金。【原文：From solar stocks to data centers, legendary investor Jim Chanos sees plenty of opportunities for short sellers. The problem: Bearish money managers like him are still struggling to raise capital.】

item.title: Blackstone 在新债发行狂潮中搁置 13 亿美元商业抵押债券交易

item.title: 墨西哥银行称若比索波动 "极端 "可介入
item.description: 墨西哥央行行长维多利亚-罗德里格斯（Victoria Rodriguez）说，如果货币市场波动变得 "极端"，墨西哥可能会进行干预，以恢复秩序。【原文：Mexico could intervene to restore order if currency market volatility ever becomes “extreme,” central bank Governor Victoria Rodriguez said.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长纳格尔称欧元区核心通胀 "仍非常坚挺
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，欧元区的基本消费价格增长被证明是顽固的。【原文：The euro zone’s underlying consumer price growth is proving stubborn, according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Joachim Nagel.】

item.title: 美国大型银行为何抵制更大的 "资本缓冲"？
item.description: 美国监管机构去年夏天提出了新规定，要求银行增加数十亿美元的所谓资本缓冲，以便在经济下滑时提供保护。最大的银行将承受最沉重的负担，它们必须将资本水平提高约 19%。这些规定源于 2008 年的金融危机，是在 2023 年四家中型银行倒闭后不久出台的。【原文：US regulators proposed new rules last summer requiring banks to add billions of dollars to their so-called capital cushions, which offer protection during downturns. The heaviest burdens would fall on the biggest banks, which would have to boost their capital levels by about 19%. The rules stem from the 2008 financial crisis and came out soon after the 2023 collapse of four midsize banks.】

item.title: 美联储按兵不动，华尔街的降息梦只能等待
item.description: 由于美联储预计在 2024 年仅降息一次，交易员们希望央行能更积极地降低借贷成本，华尔街在周三得到了一次现实的检验。【原文：Wall Street got a reality check on Wednesday as the Federal Reserve laid out projections for just one interest-rate cut in 2024 with traders hoping the central bank would be more aggressive in reducing borrowing costs.】
